titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Arthur N. (Arthur Nichols) Young Papers, 1918-1982
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 119 manuscript boxes, 1 envelope, 1 oversize box, 1 album box, 1 phonotape cassette

did.abstract: Diary, correspondence, reports, studies, statistical summaries, financial statements, press releases, clippings, and ephemeral publications, relating to the European financial crisis following World War I, the work of the Reparations Commission in formulating the Dawes Plan in 1924, and the economic and financial situation in China, 1929-1946

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Users must sign a statement agreeing to the conditions of use set down by A. N. Young

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Arthur N. (Arthur Nichols) Young Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

chronitem.event: Born, Los Angeles, California
A.B., Occidental College
LL.D., Occidental College
A.M., Princeton University
Ph.D., Princeton University
LL.B., George Washington University
Married Ellen May Bailey
Professor of Economics, Presbyterian College, Clinton, South Carolina
Instructor of Economics, Princeton University
Author, The Single Tax Movement in the United States
Author, Finances of the Federal District of Mexico
Adviser on taxation, Mexican Government
Trade expert, War Trade Board
Trade Commissioner to investigate financial conditions in Spain for U.S. Department of Commerce
Economist in office of foreign trade adviser, Department of State
Financial adviser to Government of Honduras
Author, Spanish Finance and Trade
Financial expert, Department of State
Economic adviser, Department of State
Associate of American observer with Reparations Commission, Paris, during preparation of Dawes Plan
Chairman, Interdepartmental Committee on Oil Pollution of Navigable Waters
Delegate to International Conference on Oil Pollution, Washington, D.C.
Expert attending World Economic Conference, Geneva
Expert on public credit, Commission of Financial Experts of Chinese Government
Financial adviser Chinese Government and Central Bank of China
Member, Chinese Flood Relief Commission
Expert, Chinese Economic Mission, Washington, D.C.
Member of committee on establishment of Central Reserve Bank
Director, China National Aviation Corporation
Vice-president, Chinese-American Institute of Cultural Relations
Vice-chairman, United China Relief Coordinating Committee
Chairman, American Relief and Red Cross in China
Trustee, China Foundation
Adviser, Chinese Government Commission of Relief and Rehabilitation
Member of Chinese delegation to Bretton Woods Financial Conference
Author, China's Economic and Financial Reconstruction
Author, Saudi Arabian Currency and Finance
Director, Point IV program in Saudi Arabia and financial adviser to Saudi Arabia
Financial Consultant, International Cooperation Administration
Lecturer, Occidental College
Consultant on taxation in Argentina
Author, China's Nation-Building Effort, 1927-37; The Financial and Economic Record

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, and printed matter collected by A.N. Young during and after his participation in the Paris Reparations Commission of 1924.

did.unittitle: Reparation developments after Dawes' Plan, 1924. Memoranda, letters and communiques.
Dawes' Plan. Reports of the reparation commission, 1924-1926.
Political attitude of leading German newspaper.
German loans in the United States, 1925-1927.
Revaluation of German currency and obligations, 1925-1926.
Lecture given by A.N. Young on reparation problems, June 1925.
War debts. United States and British matters, 1921-1927.
United States war debts. Official reports on settlements, 1921-1928.
War debts. Private and official views, 1923-1928.
Office Files of the Financial Adviser to the Government of China, 1929-1946.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, studies, statistical summaries, financial statements, press releases, news clippings, and ephemeral publications related to the economic and financial situation in China and acquired by A.N. Young as the financial adviser. Arranged in two subseries, the office files for the period 1929-1937 (boxes 7-61) and the office files for the period 1937-1946 (boxes 62-106).

did.unittitle: Domestic loans secured on Boxer Indemnity, 1926-37.
Domestic loans secured on other than customs.
Domestic loans secured on other than customs.
Debts, claims of chief countries for debts in arrears, 1930-37.
Debts, claims of chief countries for debts in arrears, 1930-37.
Efforts for a general debt settlement, 1925-31.
Efforts for a general debt settlement, 1925-31.
Debt settlements, Finance Ministry (including Tsin-Pu and Hukuang loan issues), 1934-37.

scopecontent.p: Includes Chinese American Banc of Commerce

did.unittitle: Memo on China's obligation under charge of Ministry of Railways, by Arthur N. Young. Oct. 1937.
China's Obligations under Charge of the Ministries of Railways and Communications, etc., by Arthur N. Young. Aug. 1937.

Daily reports and financial statements, November-December 1947.
Customs and Anglo-Japanese Customs Agreement, January-April 1938.
UCR, American Advisory Committee, private relief.

Joint office of four government banks, authorized loans, 1943-1946.

K.P. Chen's mission to the United States, 1939-1940.
Report by A.N. Young dated February 1934 and memorandum by Arthur Young dated October 1937.
Financing China Invasion. Report by A.N. Young submitted to John McCloy, Assistant Secretary of War, 21 October 1944.
United States bond scheme, to issuance, 1941-1942.
United States securities, from issuance 1942 to August 1943.
Japanese cost of war in China, correspondence and charts.
United States army and navy costs in China. Reverse lend-lease. Miscellaneous military matters.
Debt moratorium and negotiations from 1 February 1939.
Debt memos (China) for Stanford University Library.
Memoranda and reports by A.N. Young, June and July 1945, January and July 1937.
Exchange rates, United States dollars, quotations, 1945-1948.
Bretton Woods Conference. General post war fund.
Military aid to China. Military matters, 1945-1947.
Political and miscellaneous material, post war.

Miscellaneous material from Cyril Rogers, Central Bank of China, 1947-1948.
Blocked funds. Chinese private assets abroad, to 1947.
Clippings, statements, correspondence on United States economic embargo against Japan, including correspondence with The American Committee for Non-Participation in Japanese Aggression, 1939-1941.
China Air Mail, by Gunther Stein, 1939-1941.
Newspaper and magazine clippings on China, 1944-1949 (collected by Allen Young).
Japan and China, press clippings, 21 July to 10 August 1937.

Miscellaneous leaflets, pamphlets and publications relating to China.
Burma Road, Indo-China Route, January - June 1941.
Burma Road, Indo-China Route, June - July 1941.
Import goods by air and Stilwell road, 1943-1945.

scopecontent.p: Reports, studies, ephemeral publications, and news clippings. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Institute of Pacific Relations. Annual Reports, Conference Papers, and China Bibliography, 1938-60.
Office of the American Commercial Attache, Reports, 1932-37.
